sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Table content:
Hardware | PCI/USB ID | Working?
Touchpad | 06cb:7e7e | Yes
Keyboard | PS/2 | Yes
GPU | 1002:164c | Yes
Webcam | 04f2:b695 | Yes
Bluetooth | 0e8d:0608 | Yes
SD Card reader | 10ec:525a | Untested
Audio | 1022:15e3 | Yes
Wi-Fi | 14c3:0608 | Yes
TPM | 1022:15df | Yes

sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
Secure Boot needs to be disabled at first startup and after UEFI updates.

Sometimes Wi-Fi may not work properly (not connecting to networks). That issue can be solved by powering off laptop and holding power button for 60 seconds to reset BIOS settings.

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content:
Note: **This article or section needs expansion.** This article or section needs expansion.

This article or section needs expansion.

Secure Boot functions well with custom keys, make sure to disable automatic reverting to factory keys.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content: The BIOS interface is keyboard driven and does not require the use of a mouse.

sections.title: Thermals
sections.content: Fan control can be tuned by installing iswAUR.

sections.title: Battery
sections.content:
Battery charge limit can be tuned by iswAUR (PR: https://github.com/YoyPa/isw/issues/41).

According to MSI Center Pro there is 3 modes:

- Mode "Best for Mobility" (Charge the battery to 100% all the time)

```
# isw -s 0xef 228
```

- Mode "Balanced" (Charge the battery when under 70%, stop at 80%)

```
# isw -s 0xef 208
```

- Mode "Best for Battery" (Charge the battery when under 50%, stop at 60%)

```
# isw -s 0xef 188
```

sections.title: Keyboard
sections.content:
Toggle Fn key always on with Fn+Esc. The keyboard backlight works properly. The LEDs on the F1 (Audio mute) and F5 (Microphone status) keys do not work.

It is possible to control keyboard backlight with powerdevil-gitAUR widget after installing msi-ec-gitAUR.

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
Table content:
Key | Visible?1 | Marked?2 | Effect
Fn+Esc | Yes | Yes | XF86Fn_Esc
Fn+F1 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioMute
Fn+F2 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioLowerVolume
Fn+F3 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioRaiseVolume
Fn+F4 | Yes | Yes | XF86TouchpadToggle
Fn+F5 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioMicMute
Fn+F6 | Yes | Yes | XF86WebCam
Fn+F7 | Yes | Yes | XF86Launch1
Fn+F8 | No | Yes | Keyboard brightness change
Fn+F9 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessDown
Fn+F10 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessDown
Fn+F11 | Yes | Yes | Screen projection
Fn+F12 | Yes | Yes | XF86Launch2

1. The key is visible to xev and similar tools
1. The physical key has a symbol on it, which describes its function

sections.title: Screen overclocking
sections.content: Laptops with the 089RU model number have a B156HAN02.1 panel that can be stably overclocked from 60 Hz to 90 Hz by modifying edid settings.

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content:
Note: **This article or section is a candidate for merging with #Battery.** This article or section is a candidate for merging with #Battery.

This article or section is a candidate for merging with #Battery.

Using commands such as:

```
# isw -cp MSI_ADDRESS_DEFAULT
# isw -s 0xef 228
```

may fail showing the following error:

```
/sys/kernel/debug/ec/ec0/io: No such file or directory
```

The solution is the following command:

```
# modprobe ec_sys
```
